definition: to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
to search/to demand/to ask/to exact/large rope/isolated
surname Suo/abbr. for 索馬里|索马里[Suo3 ma3 li3], Somalia

sentences.english: He's been charged with extorting money from several shopkeepers.
sentences.chinese: 他受到指控，罪名是向几个店主勒索钱财。

sentences.english: Serena: Why would I want to be friends with somebody who blackmails me.
sentences.chinese: 我为什么要和勒索我的人做朋友。

sentences.english: It is a simple blackmailing for the companies working in the region.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个简单的敲诈勒索的公司在该地区工作。

sentences.english: None of these officials were named, but the letter writer cursingly accused them of collaborating against him in an extortion plot.
sentences.chinese: 其他官员未被提及，写信人指责三人合作密谋勒索他。

sentences.english: Take something from someone’s office and leave them a ransom note.
sentences.chinese: 从别人的办公室里拿走点什么，并留下一封勒索信。

sentences.english: They extorted every penny from us.
sentences.chinese: 他们把我们勒索得身无分文。

sentences.english: "I was cheated, how became instead I kidnap blackmail".
sentences.chinese: “我被骗了，怎么反而成了我绑架勒索”。

sentences.english: The brigands demanded tribute from passing vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 土匪向过往车辆勒索钱财。

sentences.english: Finally the family, by leading from the financial sector formal debit pay blackmailers.
sentences.chinese: 最终由领导做主，正式从财务部门支款付给勒索者。

sentences.english: I will not accept blackmailing for a normal thing, again.
sentences.chinese: 我也不会接受勒索，为正常之事，再次。

sentences.english: All the evidence points to a case of extortion with Ronaldo as the victim.
sentences.chinese: 所有证据显示，罗纳尔多是这起勒索案的受害者。
翻译成，教宗是勒索证明。

sentences.english: It was all for extortion, greed, advantages and jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 全都是基于勒索，贪婪，利益及妒忌心所致。

sentences.english: Sheldon do you understand the concept of blackmail?
sentences.chinese: 谢尔顿，你懂啥叫勒索吗？

sentences.english: But he emotionally blackmailed her saying that if she left him, who else was there for him?
sentences.chinese: 但他情绪勒索，她说，如果她离开他，谁在那里呢？

sentences.english: He often extorts money from her.

definition: to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud
to kidnap/to hijack/to abduct/to hold under duress
